title: Java Stringsubstring()Method

metadata.description: Learn about Java Stringsubstring()Method with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title:
Java String
substring
content_sections.content:
()
Method

Example
Return a substring from a string:
String myStr = "Hello, World!";
System.out.println(myStr.substring(7, 12));

Definition and Usage
The
substring()
method returns a substring from the string.
If the
end
argument is not specified then the substring will end at the end of the string.
Syntax
One of the following:
public String substring(int
start
, int
end
)
public String substring(int
start
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
start
Required. The index of the character at which the substring starts.
end
Optional. The index after the last character of the substring.
Technical Details
Returns:
A
String
containing a substring of the string.
Throws:

content_sections.title: IndexOutOfBoundsException
content_sections.content:
- If
start
or
end
are negative or they are greater than the length of the string or if
start
is greater than
end
.
Java version:
Any

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers Java Stringsubstring()Method concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Java Stringsubstring()Method effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Java Stringsubstring()Method and how to apply it in your projects.
